page.title: 06 Seasonal tasks
page.content: Arable farming is much controlled by the weather which controls any ploughing,planting or harvesting in their seasons.The busiest arable farming times are between July and October because these are the months when the silage cutting,harvesting & baling are done.The ploughing is generally done in late summer-autumn & the sowing of seeds is usually done in late autumn or early spring. Those farmers that are mixed farmers are more regular in their farming patterns because they are concerned with arable and livestock farming. With livestock farming ie dairy herds the farmer has jobs all year round.A herd must be milked at 6am & 4pm for 4 hours every day.With sheep less attention is needed,except at lambing time(Feb.-April)and shearing time(May-June).Beef cattle need least.
